    • Method Detail

      • setDefaults

        public void setDefaults()
        Set acceptable defaults for our form

      • validateUpload

        public ValidatorResult validateUpload(HttpServletRequest request)
        Validate a file-upload. This checks that:
        • The file exists
        • The file isn't too large
        • If the file is text, its contents are valid after macro-substitution
        Parameters:
        request - the incoming request
        Returns:
        a ValidatorResult.. The list is empty if everything is OK

      • updateFromRevision

        public void updateFromRevision(HttpServletRequest request,
                      ConfigRevision cr)
        Given the incoming request, fill us in with revision info
        Parameters:
        request - the request
        cr - the revision we're getting data from

      • canDisplayContent

        protected boolean canDisplayContent(ConfigRevision cr)
        You can DISPLAY content IFF - It's not a directory - It's not binary - It's not "too damn big"
        Parameters:
        cr - file of interest
        Returns:
        true IFF the above conditions are true

      • canEditContent

        protected boolean canEditContent(User user,
                     ConfigRevision cr)
        You can edit a file IFF: - You're a config-admin, and this is a GLOBAL channel - You're a system-admin, and this is a LOCAL or SANDBOX channel
        Parameters:
        user - logged-in user making the request
        cr - revision to be edited
        Returns:
        true IFF user has write-access to the file

      • toData

        public ConfigFileData toData()
        Returns:
        a ConfigFileData representation of this Form

      • toRevisedData

        public ConfigFileData toRevisedData(ConfigRevision rev)
        Returns a ConfigFileData representation of this Form, similar to toData() however in addition it replicates the contents of the passed in revision rev to the ConfigFileData.. This is mainly used in the FileDetailAction where want the contents of a "non-displayable" file replicated on to the newer revision...
        Parameters:
        rev - the revision to replicate the content stream.
        Returns:
        the newly updated revision..
